headerDisplay: For help and support please visit our GitHub Wiki. We hope you find this plugin useful!

username.title: Username
username.description: Your eWeLink username, please use your main eWeLink credentials (not a secondary/shared account).

password.title: Password
password.description: Your eWeLink password, can also be a base64 encoded version of your password.

mode.title: Connection Mode
mode.description: This setting defines how the plugin communicates with your devices. For further guidance, please refer to this wiki article.

disableDeviceLogging.title: Disable Device Logging
disableDeviceLogging.description: Global logging setting for accessory status changes. If true then accessory status changes will not be logged. This can also be set per accessory later in the config.

disableNoResponse.title: Disable 'No Response'
disableNoResponse.description: If true, devices marked as cloud-offline will not be shown as 'No Response' in HomeKit.

ignoredHomes.title: Ignored Homes
ignoredHomes.description: A list of comma-separated eWeLink home ids to ignore.

countryCode.title: Country Code
countryCode.description: Override the default country code, may help with login issues for users in other regions.

appId.title: App ID
appId.description: Available if you want to override the eWeLink App ID.

appSecret.title: App Secret
appSecret.description: Available if you want to override the eWeLink App Secret.

httpHost.title: HTTP Host
httpHost.description: Available if you want to override the API host.

apiPort.title: Internal API Port
apiPort.description: Port to use for the internal HTTP API. Set to 0 to disable. Set to 1 to choose a randomly available port.

singleDevices.title: Single Channel Devices
singleDevices.description: Optional settings for single-channel switch, outlet and light switch devices.

label.title: Label
label.description: This setting has no effect except to help identify this device.

deviceId.title: Device ID
deviceId.description: Enter the 10 digit eWeLink Device ID to begin.

ignoreDevice.title: Hide From HomeKit
ignoreDevice.description: If true, this accessory will be removed and ignored from HomeKit.

deviceModel.title: Device Model
deviceModel.description: This setting has no effect except showing the relevant options for this model below.

showAs.title: Show As (Simulation)
showAs.description: Expose this device as a different HomeKit accessory type.

showAsMotor.title: KingArt KING-Q1/Q4 Accessory Type
showAsMotor.description: Select the accessory type to show in HomeKit.

showAsEachen.title: Garage Device Accessory Type
showAsEachen.description: Select the accessory type to show in HomeKit.

inUsePowerThreshold.title: Outlet 'In Use' Threshold
inUsePowerThreshold.description: HomeKit will set the 'In Use' status of outlet devices to true when the wattage is above this number. Must be 0 or more.

disableTimer.title: Disable Valve Timer
disableTimer.description: If true, the timer for the valve will be removed.

temperatureSource.title: Temperature Sensor ID
temperatureSource.description: Enter a eWeLink, Govee or Meross device ID which provides a current temperature reading.

isInched.title: Status By Inching
isInched.description: If true, the plugin will show the on/off status based on inching mode.

sensorType.title: Sensor Type
sensorType.description: The type of sensor to use.

operationTime.title: Operation Time (Deciseconds)
operationTime.description: Garage doors: the time to open/close the device. Locks: the time to show as unlocked. This setting is in deciseconds - count the time in seconds and multiply by 10, for example 75 for 7.5 seconds. Must be 20 or more.

operationTimeDown.title: Operation Time Down (Deciseconds)
operationTimeDown.description: If your garage door has a different operation time for up and down, use this setting to specify the operation time DOWN (in deciseconds) and the other setting to specify the operation time UP. Otherwise leave blank. Must be 20 or more.

sensorId.title: Sensor
sensorId.description: A DW2 or Zigbee contact sensor can be used for a single garage door or lock to determine the current state. Enter the 10 digit eWeLink Device ID (normally in the format 1000ab23cd). Otherwise leave blank.

hideSensor.title: Hide Sensor
hideSensor.description: Hide this contact sensor accessory from HomeKit.

obstructId.title: Obstruction Switch
obstructId.description: An optional switch that will trigger the Obstruction Detected feature depending on its value. Otherwise leave blank.

ipAddress.title: IP Address
ipAddress.description: You can manually set the IP address for this device if it cannot be discovered by the plugin.

multiDevices.title: Multi Channel Devices
multiDevices.description: Optional settings for multi-channel switch, outlet and light switch devices.

brightnessStep.title: Brightness Step
brightnessStep.description: A minimum step for the brightness slider in the Home app. Must be 1 or more.

adaptiveLightingShift.title: Adaptive Lighting Shift
adaptiveLightingShift.description: The mired for each Adaptive Lighting update will be increased by this value, making the light appear warmer. Set to -1 to remove Adaptive Lighting feature. Must be -1 or more.

offlineAsOff.title: Offline As Off
offlineAsOff.description: If true, this accessory will show as off if reported offline.

ipAddress.title: IP Address

thDevices.title: Thermostat Devices
thDevices.description: Optional settings for thermostat devices, NSPanel, TH10/16 and THR316/320.

label.title: Label
label.description: This setting has no effect except to help identify this device.

deviceId.title: Device ID
deviceId.description: Enter the 10 digit eWeLink Device ID to begin.

ignoreDevice.title: Hide From HomeKit
ignoreDevice.description: If true, this accessory will be removed and ignored from HomeKit.

deviceModel.title: Device Model
deviceModel.description: This setting has no effect except showing the relevant options for this model below.

showAs.title: Show As (Simulation)
showAs.description: Expose this device as a different HomeKit accessory type.

showHeatCool.title: Show Heat/Cool Modes
showHeatCool.description: If true, the 'Heat' and 'Cool' modes will be shown in HomeKit.

hideSwitch.title: Hide Switch
hideSwitch.description: If true, this accessory will hide the TH10/16 switch from HomeKit.

offset.title: Temperature Offset
offset.description: You can offset the temperature that the sensor reads. An offset of 2 means 2 degrees will be added to the recorded temperature. Can be positive or negative and can include a decimal point '.'.

offsetFactor.title: Temperature Offset Factor
offsetFactor.description: If true then the above value will be used as a factor, i.e. the recorded temperature will be multipled by this number instead.

humidityOffset.title: Humidity Offset
humidityOffset.description: You can offset the humidity that the sensor reads. An offset of 2 means 2% will be added to the recorded relative humidity. Can be positive or negative.

humidityOffsetFactor.title: Humidity Offset %
humidityOffsetFactor.description: If true then the above value will be used as a factor, i.e. the recorded humidity will be multipled by this number instead.

targetTempThreshold.title: Target Temperature Threshold
targetTempThreshold.description: You can add a threshold so the device only switches on when the current temperature is at least the threshold away from the target temperature. This can be useful for devices that don't require an exact temperature and you want to reduce the on-off cycles. Must be positive and can include a decimal point.

minTarget.title: Minimum Target Temperature
minTarget.description: Minimum target temperature for TH10/16 thermostat/heater/cooler simulation to show in HomeKit apps. Must be 0 or more.

maxTarget.title: Maximum Target Temperature
maxTarget.description: Maximum target temperature for TH10/16 thermostat/heater/cooler simulation to show in HomeKit apps. Must be 1 or more, and greater than the minimum value set above.

ipAddress.title: IP Address
ipAddress.description: You can manually set the IP address for this Sonoff TH10/16 if it cannot be discovered by the plugin.

deviceId.description: Enter the 10 digit eWeLink Device ID to begin.

ignoreDevice.title: Hide From HomeKit

deviceModel.title: Device Model
deviceModel.description: This setting has no effect except showing the relevant options for this model below.

showAs.description: Expose this device as a different HomeKit accessory type.

lowBattThreshold.title: Low Battery Threshold
lowBattThreshold.description: HomeKit will set the low battery status for this device when the battery (if it has one) reaches this percentage level. Must be 5 or more.

offset.title: Temperature Offset
offset.description: You can offset the temperature that the SNZB-02 sensor reads. An offset of 2 means 2 degrees will be added to the recorded temperature. Can be positive or negative and can include a decimal point '.'.

offsetFactor.title: Temperature Offset Factor
offsetFactor.description: If true then the above value will be used as a factor, i.e. the recorded temperature will be multipled by this number instead.

humidityOffset.title: Humidity Offset
humidityOffset.description: You can offset the humidity that the SNZB-02 sensor reads. An offset of 2 means 2% will be added to the recorded relative humidity. Can be positive or negative.

humidityOffsetFactor.title: Humidity Offset %
humidityOffsetFactor.description: If true then the above value will be used as a factor, i.e. the recorded humidity will be multipled by this number instead.

hideLongDouble.title: Hide Long & Double Press
hideLongDouble.description: If true, double and long press options will be hidden for this Zigbee Button.

scaleBattery.title: Scale Battery
scaleBattery.description: If true, the battery reading for this Zigbee Contact Sensor will be multiplied by 10.

sensorTimeDifference.title: Sensor Lag
sensorTimeDifference.description: An offset in seconds to ignore notifications if the delay between this Zigbee Motion/Leak activating or Zigbee Button press and the plugin receiving the notification is greater than this number. Must be 5 or more.

resetOnStartup.title: Reset Subdevices
resetOnStartup.description: If true, the plugin will remove and re-add all subdevices when the plugin initialises. Useful if adding or removing subdevices via the eWeLink app.

ipAddress.description: You can manually set the IP address for this device if it cannot be discovered by the plugin.

label.description: This setting has no effect except to help identify this device.

fullDeviceId.title: Sensor Device ID
fullDeviceId.description: Enter the Device ID of the sensor to begin (13 digits normally in the format 1000ab23cdSW2).

deviceType.title: Device Type
deviceType.description: Select the type of RF device this is.

curtainType.title: Curtain Type
curtainType.description: Select the type of accessory you would like to expose this as.

operationTime.title: Operation Time (Deciseconds)
operationTime.description: The time to open/close the device. This setting is in deciseconds - count the time in seconds and multiply by 10, for example 75 for 7.5 seconds. Must be 20 or more.

operationTimeDown.title: Operation Time Down (Deciseconds)
operationTimeDown.description: If your device has a different operation time for up and down, use this setting to specify the operation time DOWN (in deciseconds) and the other setting to specify the operation time UP. Otherwise leave blank. Must be 20 or more.

type.title: Sensor Type
type.description: Select the type of sensor you would like to expose this as.

sensorTimeLength.title: Sensor Time Length
sensorTimeLength.description: The number of seconds which the sensor tile in the Home app will light up for if this sensor is activated. Must be 1 or more.

sensorTimeDifference.title: Sensor Lag
sensorTimeDifference.description: An offset in seconds to ignore notifications if the delay between this sensor activating and the plugin receiving the notification is greater than this number. Must be 5 or more.

sensorWebHook.title: Sensor Web Hook
sensorWebHook.description: A URL for the plugin to ping when the sensor is activated.
